revised_title: The Effectiveness of Electricity in Dissolving Different Types of Urinary Calculi
tldr: The author investigates the effectiveness of electricity in dissolving different types of urinary calculi, specifically uric acid calculi and oxalate of lime calculi. The study finds that electricity can dissolve uric acid calculi more effectively than oxalate of lime calculi, and that the presence of other compounds, such as urates and phosphates, can also affect the dissolution rate.
